result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact or Sexual Intercourse w/ Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian J Cardona

records.addlTxt: Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christian J Cardona in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Christian J Cardona.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties in court for scheduling.
Defense counsel requests further adjournment to allow him additional time to review discovery.
Court grants request and orders case adjourned for further scheduling in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Christian J Cardona not in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss in court for Christian J Cardona.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Defense counsel advises Court defendant will not be entering a plea on today's date.
Court orders case adjourned for hearing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christian J Cardona in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Christian J Cardona in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
No bail argument entered on today's date.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant is waiving his demand for speedy trial.
Further, defense counsel advises Court there may be a resolution to this case.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28. 

Defendant places on the record that he is withdrawing his demand for speedy trial.

Clerk:  jms
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Christian J Cardona in court, appear by video with attorney Richard L. Voss, appear by video.  Defendant Christian J Cardona in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective P. Miner.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Christian J. Cardona - #2022005773, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Christian J. Cardona - #2022005773, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Motion for Reduction of Bail (Christian J. Cardona #2022005773 5A Cell 10 - Milwaukee County Jail 949 N 9th St. Milwaukee, WI 53233)

Defendant Christian J Cardona not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative set for status of counsel; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christian J Cardona not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Terry from the SPD's office called and stated that Atty. Katherine Graber was added to this case by mistake and requested that she be removed. Clerk removed Attorney of record from case.

Defendant Christian J Cardona in court, defendant in custody with attorney Katherine Graber appear in person. Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Graber needs more time to meet with client.
 Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michelle J.C., RJC (DOB 06/16/2017) or her immediate famil

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Christian J Cardona in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Christian J Cardona in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christian J Cardona appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
